resources.string: "If system AOD was on then AOE will light in it, instead of a custom screen (lights only without widgets). but if AOD was off the Default method will be used. this requires the permission to enable AOE as an accessibility service. AOE is indeed helpful especially for deaf people to know what notifications they got. this also uses less battery."
Display lighting and the enabled widgets in a custom new screen
Exactly similar to the method above, but AOD content will be hided. if you do not want AOD but want the advantages of the above method. REQUIRES TEXT ONLY CLOCK IN AOD SETTINGS.

"IMPORTANT NOTE: First turn off any another app for edge lighting. Search google for : Device name + apps not working in background. The exact steps for this process will vary depending on your device model. We recommend using the information here as a starting point. Some Googling with your precise model details should find instructions specific to your device. in app settings page there is an option called app restriction chose the first option if you are facing an issue. ----------------------- * Xiaomi issue in system : When you enable Notification Access Disable Xiamoi service framework then Enable Always On Edge then enable again Xiamoi service framework. Go to Security >> Battery >> App Battery Saver >> AOE >> No restrictions. Go to Security >> Permissions >> Auto start >> enable AOE. Go to Security >> Permissions >> Permissions >> AOE >> Start in background. or Go to Settings >> Installed Apps >> AOE > Battery Saver >> No Restrictions or Go to Security >> Manage Apps >> Edge Lighting >> Auto start.
----------------------- * LG Go to Settings >> Battery >> Battery Usage >> Ignore optimizations. enable ignore battery optimizations for AOE ----------------------- * Asus give it auto start permission and disable clean app in suspend in auto start manager. you need to save settings again ----------------------- * Elephone Disable the background task clear in Settings - Background task clear (slidey switch to turn off) ----------------------- * OnePlus Make sure AOE is in the auto-launch list. Open up Settings and click Apps, the gear icon, and then Apps Auto-launch. Find AOE in the list and toggle it on to enable autolaunch. for notifications lighting Turn ON New notifications in Ambient display. ----------------------- * Oppo Open Permission Monitor >> Autorun Managerment >> Select aoe. Make sure AOE is on the list of allowed start-up apps. Open Security Center, click Privacy Permissions, then Startup Manager, and then allow AOE App to start-up in the background. ----------------------- * Vivo Go to IManager >> App Manager >> Autostart Manager. Enable the auto-start setting for the AOE app. Open i Manager, click App Manager, then Autostart manager, and then allow AOE App to auto-start in the background. ----------------------- * Lenovo Enable the auto-start setting for the AOE app. Open Settings and click Power Manager and then Background app management. Flip the Allow auto-start toggle for the AOE app. ----------------------- * Huawei Go to Phone Manager >> Protect Apps >> Select. Make sure AOE is on the list of protected apps. Open System settings, then Advanced Settings, then Battery Manager, and finally Protected apps. Enable the toggle next to AOE to allow it to keep running even after the screen is turned off. ----------------------- * Samsung Disable Samsung Edge Lighting. Settings, then device maintenance, then Battery. scroll to the bottom and enter unmonitored apps and add this app. Switch off battery optimisation for AOE. Open Settings, then Apps, then the three dots on the upper right corner, then Special Access, then Optimize battery usage. From here, tap on the dropdown menu that says 'Apps not optimized’, then switch it to all apps and then switch off battery optimisation for the AOE App. Exclude the AOE app from any of the battery optimization features on your device. You'll find these in Settings, then Battery. You'll need to disable battery optimization for the AOE app, as well as checking to make sure the Restrict background data setting is disabled. ----------------------- * Meizu please go to app info and give it Allow running in background instead of Smart background. the problem is all about how Flyme OS is an oddly edited Android OS. please also search for standby management, Auto-launched apps, Notifications of apps, Memory acceleration whitelist. ----------------------- "
Reminder, while screen is off, repeat lighting for 8 seconds every %1$d seconds.
So that the app does not bother you during the phone call and stops working until you finish, phone state permission is needed, only call state not its details permission
SmartUnlock, when device on flat surface and I pick it up, close and open screen (more power)
pocket mode, close when in pocket or screen faced down, resume when out (more power)

" Privacy Policy Your privacy is important to us. It is AOE's policy to respect your privacy regarding any information we may collect from you through our app, Always On Edge. We only ask for personal information when we truly need it to provide a service to you. We collect it by fair and lawful means, with your knowledge and consent. We also let you know why we're collecting it and how it will be used. We only retain collected information for as long as necessary to provide you with your requested service. What data we store, we'll protect within commercially acceptable means to prevent loss and theft, as well as unauthorised access, disclosure, copying, use or modification. We don't share any personally identifying information publicly or with third-parties, except when required to by law. Our app may link to external sites that are not operated by us. Please be aware that we have no control over the content and practices of these sites, and cannot accept responsibility or liability for their respective privacy policies. You are free to refuse our request for your personal information, with the understanding that we may be unable to provide you with some of your desired services. Your continued use of our app will be regarded as acceptance of our practices around privacy and personal information. If you have any questions about how we handle user data and personal information, feel free to contact us. This policy is effective as of 10 June 2019.
AOE Terms of Service 1.
